data.sampled: There are currently no cures for Ebolapart from supportive care and experimental vaccines. The most promising treatment at this time is to support patients' immune systems through transfusions of blood from survivors and other donors, along with medications to boost their strength and prevent organ damage. There is also ongoing research into developing an effective vaccine.

data.sampled:
File your taxes on time and avoid penalties by following these five tips:

1. Make sure you have all the necessary paperwork ready before April 15th: Keep track of your income, expenses, tax forms, and other important documents so that you can easily prepare and submit your taxes on time.

2. Use online tools: There are many websites and apps available that make it easy tofile your taxes, including TaxAct, H&R Block, and TurboTax. These tools can help you complete your return quickly and accurately.

3. Consider using a paid tax preparation service: Many companies offer paid tax services that can help you save time and reduce stress. They will work with you to ensure that your returns are accurate and filed correctly.

4. Get professional advice: If you're still unsure about how to file your taxes, consider seeking the guidance of a tax advisor who can explain your options in detail and provide you with personalized assistance.

5. File early: The earlier you file your taxes, the better chance you have of avoiding late fees and interest charges. It's also helpful to consult with a tax expert if you have complex tax issues.

data.sampled:
Sure! Here are some vegetarian dishes that can be varied according to taste and dietary requirements. 

Vegetable Fried Rice: Cook rice according to package instructions until tender. Add soy sauce, vegetables (such as carrots, broccoli, bell peppers), eggs and pea shoots. Stir-fry in hot oil until crispy and cooked through.
Sweet & Sour Vegetables: Steam or boil vegetables such as bok choy, carrots, sweet potatoes, corn and peas until crisp-tender. Drain and mix with brown sugar, vinegar, chili powder and ginger. Serve over rice or noodles.
Pad Thai: Make rice dough from sticky rice flour and add egg, prawns, vegetables (such as bean sprouts, carrots, zucchini) and cashews. Simmer in coconut milk and served with toppings like green onions, cilantro and chile paste.
Vegetarian Chili: Soak dried beans overnight before cooking them with onion, garlic, canned tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, oregano and paprika. Serve with cornbread or crackers.
Tempeh Tacos: Grill tempeh patties until crispy on both sides. Fill tortillas with lettuce, cheese, salsa, guacamole and sour cream. Add taco seasoning and serve warm. 
Vegan Broccoli Cheese Soup: Saute chopped broccoli, onion and celery in butter until softened. Add vegan chicken stock, salt, pepper and nutritional yeast. simmer until thickened. Serve with breadsticks or crackers.
Green Goddess Pasta: Boil pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and stir in sautéed kale, roasted almonds, garlic, lemon juice and avocado oil. Season with sea salt and pepper.
This list provides a starting point for creating unique and flavorful vegetarian meals that suit individual tastes and dietary needs.
